branchCategory.name: LEHZ, Electric Gripper, 2 Finger, Vertical Type
branchCategory.description: The LEHZ is the most common electric gripper, with the most sizes. The motor drives a slide screw coupled to a lever assembly. The levers open and close the fingers, which follow a linear guide for alignment and stability. The narrow fingers are 12 to 36 mm long, with several optional tool mounting arrangements. A flat finger option is also available.
branchCategory.bullets: <UL> <LI>Body sizes: 10, 16, 20, 25, 32, 40 <LI>Compact motor option available: 10, 16, 20, 25 <LI>Stroke range: 4 to 30 mm <LI>Gripping force range: 2 to 210 N <LI>3 finger mounting options for custom tooling <LI>Manual adjustment screw for moving fingers with power off</LI></UL>
